intro: Synaedrys dolichocarpa, commonly known as the long-fruited synaedrys, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a shrub or small tree native to tropical regions of Africa. The plant is characterized by its opposite, simple, and often hairy leaves. Its flowers are small and usually white or yellow, arranged in clusters. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its dispersal in the wild.
